org.dynalang.dynalink.linker

Class CallSiteDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dynalang.dynalink.linker.CallSiteDescriptor

  • public abstract class CallSiteDescriptor
extends Object
    A descriptor of a call site. Used in place of passing a real call site to guarding linkers so they aren't tempted to directly manipulate them; also it carries the tokenized name of the method and the MethodHandles.Lookup object for the class in which the call site is in.
    Version:
    $Id: $
    Author:
    Attila Szegedi

    • Method Detail

      • getNameTokenCount

        public abstract int getNameTokenCount()
        Returns the number of tokens in the name of the method at the call site. Method names are tokenized with the colon ":" character, i.e. "dyn:getProp:color" would be the name used to describe a method that retrieves the property named "color" on the object it is invoked on.
        Returns:
        the number of tokens in the name of the method at the call site.

      • getNameToken

        public abstract String getNameToken(int i)
        Returns the ith token in the method name at the call site. Method names are tokenized with the colon ":" character.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the token. Must be between 0 (inclusive) and getNameTokenCount() (exclusive)
        Returns:
        the ith token in the method name at the call site.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the index is outside the allowed range.

      • getName

        public abstract String getName()
        Returns the name of the method at the call site. Note that the object internally only stores the tokenized name, and has to reconstruct the full name from tokens on each invocation.
        Returns:
        the name of the method at the call site.

      • getMethodType

        public abstract MethodType getMethodType()
        The type of the method at the call site.
        Returns:
        type of the method at the call site.

      • getLookup

        public abstract MethodHandles.Lookup getLookup()
        Returns the lookup passed to the bootstrap method.
        Returns:
        the lookup passed to the bootstrap method.

      • getAdditionalBootstrapArgumentCount

        public abstract int getAdditionalBootstrapArgumentCount()
        Returns the number of additional static bootstrap arguments at the call site.
        Returns:
        the number of additional static bootstrap arguments at the call site; it can be between 0 and 251.

      • getAdditionalBootstrapArgument

        public abstract Object getAdditionalBootstrapArgument(int i)
        Returns the ith additional static bootstrap argument at the call site.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the argument. Must be between 0 (inclusive) and getAdditionalBootstrapArgumentCount() (exclusive).
        Returns:
        the ith additional static bootstrap argument at the call site.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the index is outside the allowed range.

      • dropParameterTypes

        public abstract CallSiteDescriptor dropParameterTypes(int from,
                                    int to)
        Creates a new call site descriptor from this descriptor, which is identical to this, except it drops few of the parameters from the method type.
        Parameters:
        from - the index of the first parameter to drop
        to - the index of the first parameter after "from" not to drop
        Returns:
        a new call site descriptor with the parameter dropped.

      • changeParameterType

        public abstract CallSiteDescriptor changeParameterType(int num,
                                     Class<?> newType)
        Creates a new call site descriptor from this descriptor, which is identical to this, except it changes the type of one of the parameters in the method type.
        Parameters:
        num - the index of the parameter type to change
        newType - the new type for the parameter
        Returns:
        a new call site descriptor, with the type of the parameter in the method type changed.

      • create

        public static CallSiteDescriptor create(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup,
                        String name,
                        MethodType methodType,
                        Object... bootstrapArgs)
        Creates a new call site descriptor instance. The actual underlying class of the instance is dependent on the passed arguments to be space efficient; i.e. if you don't use either a non-public lookup or static bootstrap arguments, you'll get back an implementation that doesn't waste space on storing them.
        Parameters:
        lookup - the lookup that determines access rights at the call site. If your language runtime doesn't have equivalents of Java access concepts, just use MethodHandles.publicLookup(). Must not be null.
        name - the name of the method at the call site. Must not be null.
        methodType - the type of the method at the call site. Must not be null.
        bootstrapArgs - additional static bootstrap arguments. Can be null.
        Returns:
        a new call site descriptor.
